1/* $NetBSD: tcpmsg.h,v 1.3 2019/01/09 16:55:12 christos Exp $ */

14
15#ifndef DNS_TCPMSG_H
16#define DNS_TCPMSG_H 1
17
18/*! \file dns/tcpmsg.h */
19
20#include <inttypes.h>
21
22#include <isc/buffer.h>
23#include <isc/lang.h>
24#include <isc/socket.h>
25
26typedef struct dns_tcpmsg {
27 /* private (don't touch!) */
28 unsigned int magic;
29 uint16_t size;
30 isc_buffer_t buffer;
31 unsigned int maxsize;
32 isc_mem_t *mctx;
33 isc_socket_t *sock;
34 isc_task_t *task;
35 isc_taskaction_t action;
36 void *arg;
37 isc_event_t event;
38 /* public (read-only) */
39 isc_result_t result;
40 isc_sockaddr_t address;
41} dns_tcpmsg_t;
42
43ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
44
45void
46dns_tcpmsg_init(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_socket_t *sock, dns_tcpmsg_t *tcpmsg);
47/*%<
48 * Associate a tcp message state with a given memory context and
49 * TCP socket.
50 *
51 * Requires:
52 *
53 *\li "mctx" and "sock" be non-NULL and valid types.
54 *
55 *\li "sock" be a read/write TCP socket.
56 *
57 *\li "tcpmsg" be non-NULL and an uninitialized or invalidated structure.
58 *
59 * Ensures:
60 *
61 *\li "tcpmsg" is a valid structure.
62 */
63
64void
65dns_tcpmsg_setmaxsize(dns_tcpmsg_t *tcpmsg, unsigned int maxsize);
66/*%<
67 * Set the maximum packet size to "maxsize"
68 *
69 * Requires:
70 *
71 *\li "tcpmsg" be valid.
72 *
73 *\li 512 <= "maxsize" <= 65536
74 */
75
76isc_result_t
77dns_tcpmsg_readmessage(dns_tcpmsg_t *tcpmsg,
78 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg);
79/*%<
80 * Schedule an event to be delivered when a DNS message is readable, or
81 * when an error occurs on the socket.
82 *
83 * Requires:
84 *
85 *\li "tcpmsg" be valid.
86 *
87 *\li "task", "taskaction", and "arg" be valid.
88 *
89 * Returns:
90 *
91 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS -- no error
92 *\li Anything that the isc_socket_recv() call can return. XXXMLG
93 *
94 * Notes:
95 *
96 *\li The event delivered is a fully generic event. It will contain no
97 * actual data. The sender will be a pointer to the dns_tcpmsg_t.
98 * The result code inside that structure should be checked to see
99 * what the final result was.
100 */
101
102void
103dns_tcpmsg_cancelread(dns_tcpmsg_t *tcpmsg);
104/*%<
105 * Cancel a readmessage() call. The event will still be posted with a
106 * CANCELED result code.
107 *
108 * Requires:
109 *
110 *\li "tcpmsg" be valid.
111 */
112
113void
114dns_tcpmsg_keepbuffer(dns_tcpmsg_t *tcpmsg, isc_buffer_t *buffer);
115/*%<
116 * If a dns buffer is to be kept between calls, this function marks the
117 * internal state-machine buffer as invalid, and copies all the contents
118 * of the state into "buffer".
119 *
120 * Requires:
121 *
122 *\li "tcpmsg" be valid.
123 *
124 *\li "buffer" be non-NULL.
125 */
126
127void
128dns_tcpmsg_invalidate(dns_tcpmsg_t *tcpmsg);
129/*%<
130 * Clean up all allocated state, and invalidate the structure.
131 *
132 * Requires:
133 *
134 *\li "tcpmsg" be valid.
135 *
136 * Ensures:
137 *
138 *\li "tcpmsg" is invalidated and disassociated with all memory contexts,
139 * sockets, etc.
140 */
141
142ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
143
144#endif /* DNS_TCPMSG_H */
145
